result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvia Katarzyna Hass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To each other; credit for 4 days time served as to Count 1 only.  Huber privileges for work, treatment and school.

miscConds.notes: *Pay restitution in the amount of $99.92 to Walmart; cash bail on deposit to be applied.
*Pay all costs and surcharges commencing September 15, 2016 at the rate of $25.00 per month or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*Obtain/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

16A 031125: Applied in error and corrected please ref. #16A031159.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Sylvia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 and 2:

The defendant was advised of her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 8/11/2016 at 8:30, branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sylvia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target and co-def:  Salvador Rivas.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sylvia Katarzyna Hass in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Sylvia Katarzyna Hass in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Sylvia Katarzyna Hass not in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-073

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
